landing_subtitle: This application provides access to several coaching bot characters with different perspectives and coaching styles. You can create a 'life context' file to personalize conversations and update it with new insights after each session.
landing_dragDrop: Drag your .md file here, or click to browse
landing_createFile: Create a New Life Context File
landing_privacyText: If you continue as a guest, your data is processed locally in your browser. No data is stored on our servers. You are responsible for saving your file at the end of each session.
landing_error_invalidFile: Invalid file type. Please upload a .md file.
landing_error_invalidHeader: Invalid file content. The file must start with the headline '# My Life Context' or '# Lebenskontext'.
landing_error_emptyFile: The selected file is empty or could not be read.
auth_subtitle: Create an account to save your progress automatically, or continue as a guest and manage your data manually.
login_error_credentials: Invalid email or password. Please try again.
register_newsletter_desc: I want to receive news and updates via email (unsubscribe anytime)
register_error_short_password: Password must be at least 6 characters long.
register_error_exists: An account with this email already exists.
register_pending_subtitle: Thank you for registering! We've sent a verification link to your email address. Please click the link to activate your account.
register_pending_spam: If you don't see the email, please check your spam or junk folder.
verifyEmail_success_subtitle: You will be logged in automatically.
verifyEmail_enter_password: Please enter your password to complete the login.
forgotPassword_subtitle: Enter your email address to receive a password reset link.
forgotPassword_warning_text: Password reset will delete all your stored life context data due to end-to-end encryption. If you still know your password, use the "Change Password" feature in the menu instead.
forgotPassword_success: If an account with this email exists, a password reset link has been sent.
resetPassword_warning_text: Due to end-to-end encryption, all your stored life context data will be deleted when you reset your password. You will start with an empty context.
resetPassword_success_subtitle: You can now log in with your new password.
contextChoice_intro: You have a saved Life Context.
contextChoice_question: Would you like to continue with it or start fresh?
contextChoice_confirm_warning: Starting fresh will clear the context for this session. Your cloud data will be overwritten on the next save. We recommend downloading a backup first.
piiWarning_subtitle: The file you generated may contain Personally Identifiable Information (PII). Please review it and remove any sensitive data you are not comfortable sharing.
piiWarning_list:
Full names of real people
Email addresses, phone numbers, or physical addresses
Social security numbers or other government IDs
Financial account information
piiWarning_advice: It's best practice to use pseudonyms or general descriptions instead of real names or specific identifiers.
questionnaire_subtitle: Answer the following questions to generate a starting point for your conversations. You can skip any questions you're not comfortable with. For list-based fields, it's helpful to start each item on a new line with an asterisk (*).
questionnaire_error_name_required: Please provide a name or a calling name.
q_field_name_prompt: Your first name, nickname, or pseudonym...
q_field_sentiment_prompt: e.g., 'Feeling motivated by my new project lead, but also a bit stressed about the increased workload...'
q_section_formative_events_desc: What milestones and events have shaped you?
q_field_formative_events_prompt:
* e.g. 'Moved to a new city for university'
* e.g. 'Traveled through Southeast Asia for 3 months'
* e.g. 'Overcame a significant personal challenge'
q_section_domains_desc: The main areas of my life, each with its own goals and challenges.
q_field_situation_prompt_career: e.g., 'I'm a Project Manager leading a small team. The work is challenging and I enjoy it, but the long hours are starting to affect my home life.'
q_field_routines_prompt_career:
* I block out 'deep work' time in my calendar
* I check my emails only twice a day
q_field_goals_prompt_career:
* Get promoted to Senior Manager
* Learn a new programming language
q_field_challenges_prompt_career:
* I struggle to delegate tasks effectively
* I have a hard time saying 'no' to new requests
q_field_situation_prompt_growth: e.g., 'I've been reading a lot about leadership but struggle to apply the concepts. I'd like to be a more confident decision-maker.'
q_field_routines_prompt_growth:
* I listen to a business podcast during my commute
* I read for 30 minutes before bed
q_field_goals_prompt_growth:
* Read one non-fiction book per month
* Complete an online course on public speaking
q_field_challenges_prompt_growth:
* I get distracted easily when trying to study
* I don't make time for deliberate practice
q_field_situation_prompt_relationships: e.g., 'I'm happily married, but my partner and I don't get as much quality time together as we'd like due to our busy schedules.'
q_field_routines_prompt_relationships:
* We have a 'no-phones' dinner together
* I call my parents every Sunday
q_field_goals_prompt_relationships:
* Plan a dedicated date night with my partner once a week
* Reconnect with an old friend this month
q_field_challenges_prompt_relationships:
* I often feel too tired after work to be social
* I find it hard to open up to new people
q_field_situation_prompt_health: e.g., 'I'm fairly active and enjoy running, but stress often disrupts my sleep. I'd like to build more consistent healthy habits.'
q_field_routines_prompt_health:
* I go for a run 3 times a week
* I meditate for 10 minutes every morning
q_field_goals_prompt_health:
* Run a 10k race by the end of the year
* Get 7-8 hours of sleep per night
q_field_challenges_prompt_health:
* I have a sweet tooth and struggle with late-night snacking
* I lack motivation to work out in the winter
q_section_nextsteps_desc: Specific, actionable tasks you have committed to.
q_field_nextsteps_prompt_list:
* Talk to my manager about workload (Deadline: this week)
* Sign up for the gym (Deadline: tomorrow)
botSelection_subtitle: Each coach has a unique style. Choose one that resonates with your current needs.
botSelection_guestMessage: To unlock more coaches, please register for an account.
botSelection_registeredMessage: Unlock premium coaches by redeeming an upgrade code in the menu.
botSelection_premiumMessage: Rob and Victor are only available for clients.
botSelection_clientAccessMessage: These coaches are exclusively available for manualmode.at clients. Contact us for more information.
guest_limit_warning: You have reached your weekly limit of 50 messages. Register for unlimited access.
guest_limit_exceeded_message: You have reached your weekly limit of 50 messages as a guest. Register for unlimited access to all features.
test_mode_banner: Test Mode: Simulated conversation ‚Äì Click "End Session" to start analysis
test_mode_input_disabled: In test mode, no new messages can be sent.
update_available_desc: A new version of the app is available.
chat_welcome: Hello, I'm {{botName}}. What's on your mind today?
chat_error: I'm sorry, an error occurred while processing your request. Please try again.
chat_report_message: Report an issue with this message
chat_tapToSpeak: Voice mode is active. Tap the microphone to speak.
analyzing_subtitle: Your coach is preparing your session summary.
sessionReview_subtitle: Here's a summary of your conversation. You can apply the proposed updates to your life context.
sessionReview_g_subtitle: Here is the Life Context file generated from your interview with Gloria.
sessionReview_g_summary: This session was dedicated to setting up your life context file.
sessionReview_rating_prompt: How would you rate your conversation with {{botName}}?
sessionReview_feedback_prompt: Thank you. Could you share what could be improved?
sessionReview_feedback_prompt_optional: Great! Would you like to add a comment? (optional)
sessionReview_feedback_placeholder_optio: What went well or could be improved? (optional)
sessionReview_contact_consent: By submitting, you consent to be contacted by the developer for follow-up regarding your feedback.
sessionReview_nextSteps_hint: Select which steps should be added:
sessionReview_xpBonus_formalClose: You've earned a 50 XP bonus for completing a full coaching session!
sessionReview_xpBonus_goalAccomplished: You've earned a 25 XP bonus for accomplishing one of your goals!
sessionReview_blockages_subtitle: Based on PEP by Dr. Michael Bohne, your coach noticed patterns that might be hindering your progress. This is an experimental feature for beta testers.
sessionReview_no_blockages: No specific solution blockages were identified in this session.
sessionReview_no_updates: No updates were proposed in this session.
sessionReview_preventSave_label: Don't save text changes to my cloud profile for this session.
sessionReview_preventSave_desc: Your gamification progress (XP, achievements) will still be saved to your account. Only the text changes from this session will be discarded from your cloud profile.
sessionReview_guestWarning_p1: Your session progress is not saved automatically.
sessionReview_guestWarning_p2: To keep your new insights, you must download your updated context file using the button below.
sessionReview_guestWarning_p3: If you decide to register or log in later, you will need to upload this downloaded file to restore your progress.
sessionReview_testMode_warning_desc: You are in a test session. Saving will update the context for this test run only and will not affect your personal saved data. You will be returned to the admin console after saving.
sessionReview_testMode_warning_desc_shor: Test mode: Saving is temporary and will not affect your personal data. You will be returned to the admin console.
achievement_polymath_desc: Held a session with 3 different coaches.
account_edit_profile_desc: Manage your name and newsletter settings
account_change_password_desc: Change your password for better security
account_management_footer: All changes take effect immediately. Account deletion is permanent.
profile_newsletter_desc: Receive news and updates via email
user_guide_attention_guest: Guest Users: Your progress is only saved if you manually download your Life Context file at the end of each session review. If you close the browser without downloading, your progress is lost.
user_guide_attention_registered: Registered Users: Your data is end-to-end encrypted. If you forget your password, your data cannot be recovered and will be permanently lost. We recommend making regular backups by downloading your file.
formatting_p1: You can use basic Markdown to structure your Life Context file. This helps the AI understand the document's hierarchy.
formatting_headings_p1: Use hashtags to create main sections and sub-sections.
formatting_bold_p1: A common pattern is to use bold text for a key followed by a colon.
formatting_emphasis_p1: You can emphasize text using asterisks for italics or double asterisks for bold. This is useful for highlighting key terms or ideas within a paragraph.
formatting_emphasis_code:
*This will be italic.*
**This will be bold.**
formatting_lists_p1: Use asterisks or dashes for bullet points.
formatting_lists_warning: Important: Avoid starting a bullet point directly with a bolded sub-headline (e.g., * **My Topic**: ...). This can confuse the update parser. Instead, integrate bold text naturally within your sentence (e.g., * Regarding **My Topic**: ...).
formatting_separators_p1: You can use three or more hyphens (`---`) on their own line to create a horizontal rule. This is a great way to visually separate major sections of your document.
formatting_separators_code:
## üë§ Core Profile

**I am...**: Alex

---

## üß≠ Life Domains
formatting_manual_p1: You can always manually edit the final context on the Session Review screen before saving or downloading. You can also edit the file after downloading it with a .md editor of your choice using the design elements mentioned.
formatting_manual_p2: A well-structured document leads to a better quality coaching session.
how_it_works_subtitle_1: Most AIs forget you as soon as the window is closed.
how_it_works_subtitle_2: builds a memory ‚Äì secure, private, and transparent.
how_it_works_step1_desc: Stoic calm, strategic analysis, or empathetic listening? Choose the style that matches your mood. The knowledge comes from your Life Context.
how_it_works_step2_desc: Use Voice Mode for natural conversations or write in the chat. Your coach makes connections you might have missed.
how_it_works_step3_desc: Get a summary and export Action Items directly to your calendar. Don't let resolutions fade away.
how_it_works_step4_desc: The app suggests updates for your Life Context. New insights are saved ‚Äì you don't have to repeat yourself next time.
how_it_works_trust1_desc: End-to-end encryption or complete guest mode. Your thoughts belong to you.
how_it_works_trust2_desc: Seamless switching between DE/EN with carefully selected premium voices.
how_it_works_trust3_desc: Stay on track with XP, streaks, and achievements for your mental work.
disclaimer_delete_warning: Deleting your account is a permanent action and cannot be undone. All of your data, including your encrypted life context and progress, will be irretrievably deleted.
export_data_description: Download a complete copy of all your stored personal data. This complies with your right to data portability under Art. 20 GDPR.
export_data_includes_account: Account information (email, registration date, login data)
export_data_note_encrypted: Your encrypted Life Context will be automatically decrypted for export (GDPR compliant).
export_data_gdpr_compliance: ‚úÖ GDPR compliant: Your Life Context will be decrypted and displayed in a readable format in the export, as required by Art. 15 & 20 GDPR.
export_data_format_html_desc: A beautifully formatted, easy-to-read webpage with all your data
export_data_format_json_desc: Technical format for developers and data portability
export_data_success: Your data has been successfully exported!
export_data_error: Error exporting data. Please try again.
export_data_gdpr_note: This is your legal right under Art. 15 and 20 GDPR.
redeem_subtitle: Have an upgrade code? Enter it here to unlock new features or coaches.
redeem_error_invalid: The code is invalid, expired, or has already been used.
redeem_error_generic: An error occurred. Please try again.
redeem_info_text: For information about upgrade codes, visit
admin_runner_desc: This tool runs a pre-defined test scenario through the application's live analysis logic. It makes a real API call to the backend and displays the actual results, allowing you to quickly verify functionality. This does NOT affect your own saved user data.
admin_no_users_found: No users found matching your search.
admin_users_cannot_change_self: You cannot change your own admin status.
admin_no_codes_yet: No upgrade codes have been generated yet.
admin_tickets_no_tickets: Inbox is clear. No open support tickets.
admin_feedback_no_feedback: No feedback has been submitted yet.
admin_ratings_no_ratings: No ratings have been submitted yet.
admin_no_message_reports: No message reports have been submitted.
admin_reset_success_desc: The password for {{email}} has been reset. Please securely share the new temporary password with the user.
admin_reset_confirm_part1: Are you sure you want to reset the password for
admin_reset_confirm_warning_title: CRITICAL WARNING: DATA LOSS WILL OCCUR
admin_reset_confirm_warning_desc: This user's life context is end-to-end encrypted. Resetting the password will make their existing data permanently unreadable. Their life context file will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.
changePassword_error_short: New password must be at least 6 characters long.
changePassword_error_generic: An unknown error occurred. Please try again.
deleteAccount_warning: This action is final and cannot be undone. All of your data, including your profile and progress, will be permanently deleted.
deleteAccount_confirmation: To confirm, please type the following text into the box below: {{requiredText}}
deleteAccount_error_mismatch: The confirmation text does not match.
deleteAccount_error_api: An error occurred while deleting your account. Please try again.
voiceModal_auto_desc: Automatically selects the best available voice
voiceModal_server_voices_desc: Generated by our server ‚Ä¢ May have longer loading times
voiceModal_ios_hint: Server voices are not available on iOS due to browser audio restrictions. Please select a device voice instead.
voiceModal_local_voices_desc: Installed on your device ‚Ä¢ Instantly available
voiceModal_native_voices_desc: Installed on your device ‚Ä¢ Instantly available
voiceModal_preview_text: Hello, this is a preview of my voice.
voiceModal_no_voices_desc: This app uses the voices installed on your device. To enable voice output, you may need to add a suitable voice via your operating system's language or accessibility settings.
voiceModal_no_local_voices_desc: Your device does not have suitable local voices. You can use server voices instead.
feedback_description: Thank you for helping improve the conversation quality. Please provide details on what went wrong.
feedback_commentsPlaceholder: e.g., The response was repetitive, irrelevant, or factually incorrect...
feedback_contact_consent: You consent to be contacted by the developer via email for follow-up regarding this report.
feedback_successMessage: Thank you for helping us improve.
blockageScore_subtitle: This score indicates the potential presence of recurring thought patterns that might hinder progress. A lower score is better.
paywall_description_new: To access Meaningful Conversations, please purchase a pass or redeem an access code. Accounts created after January 1, 2026 will require an active pass.
paywall_description_expired: Your access pass for the account {{email}} has expired. To continue using Meaningful Conversations, please purchase a new pass or redeem an access code.
error_network_detailed:
Could not connect to the server at {{url}}. Please ensure the backend service is running and accessible. 

You can test this by opening the following health check URL in a new browser tab: {{url}}/api/health
scenario_simple_update_desc: A simple conversation about improving a morning routine.
scenario_simple_update_user: I want to improve my morning routine.
scenario_simple_update_bot: That's a great goal. What does your current routine look like?
scenario_simple_update_user2: I just scroll on my phone for 20 minutes. I'd like to replace that with reading a book.
scenario_complex_update_desc: A conversation about a recent promotion leading to work-life balance issues and self-doubt.
scenario_complex_update_user1: My work situation has changed recently.
scenario_complex_update_bot1: Tell me more about that. What's new?
scenario_complex_update_user2: I've been promoted to Team Lead. The work is engaging, but I find it hard to disconnect after hours.
scenario_complex_update_bot2: That sounds like a common challenge with new leadership roles. What makes disconnecting difficult for you?
scenario_complex_update_user3: I feel responsible for everything, and I worry that if I'm not available, something will go wrong. I know I need to trust my team more, but it's hard. I really should be better at delegating by now. On top of that, all this stress is making me think about my finances. I don't have any real savings plan, which is another source of anxiety.
scenario_next_steps_desc: A conversation about spirituality that should provoke a NEW category in the life context.
scenario_next_steps_user1: I'm very interested in meditation and want to explore Buddhism more deeply.
scenario_next_steps_bot1: That's a fascinating spiritual path. What draws you most to Buddhism?
scenario_next_steps_user2: The mindfulness practice and the philosophy of non-attachment. I want to attend a meditation retreat by next month.
scenario_interview_desc: A short interview with Gloria to test the context generation and formatting.
scenario_interview_chathistory_bot: Hello, to start, what name should I call you during our conversation?
scenario_interview_chathistory_bot2: Thank you, Alex. To begin, could you tell me a little about your core values?
scenario_interview_chathistory_user2: I would say my main values are integrity and continuous personal growth.

comfort_check_description: How authentic were you in this session? This helps refine your personality profile over time.
comfort_check_privacy_desc: Session data is end-to-end encrypted. Only you can decrypt it.
comfort_check_privacy_desc_v2: Only anonymous keyword frequencies are stored, no conversation content. You can download the transcript after the session.
comfort_check_low_score_warning: Score < 3: Session will not be used for profile refinement
comfort_check_note: Sessions with score ‚â• 3 will be used for profile refinement
profile_view_refined_desc: This profile has been refined through {{count}} authentic sessions.
stress_reaction_description: How you typically react under pressure (1 = first reaction):
stress_reaction_distanz_desc: Close the door, solve problems alone
profile_overwrite_sessions: üìä Your profile has been refined through {{count}} coaching sessions.
profile_overwrite_loss_warning: These individual adaptations are based on your actual behavior and will be considered when creating a new personality signature.
profile_overwrite_warning_question: A new test means a FRESH START. Your current profile cannot be restored afterwards. Are you sure, or would you like to create a new signature first?
refinement_description: Based on {{count}} authentic sessions, we have the following refinements for your profile:
refinement_no_suggestions: Not enough sessions for suggestions (minimum 2 required)
refinement_info_desc: These suggestions are based on your observed behavior. You decide whether to accept them.
scenario_dpc_riemann_desc: Tests DPC with clear duration orientation - Coach should respond in a structured and methodical way
scenario_dpc_riemann_user1: I'm really stressed at work right now. My boss gave me a new project and I don't even know where to start.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot1: That sounds like a challenging situation. Tell me more - what exactly bothers you most about the new project?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user2: There's no clear plan. No deadline overview, no milestones. Just 'get it done'. It's driving me crazy.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot2: I hear that structure and clarity are important to you. The lack of a clear framework creates uncertainty. How do you normally approach a new project?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user3: Usually I first create a detailed task list and a schedule. But here I don't even know what's involved.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot3: A structured approach has helped you before. What would be the smallest first step to gain more clarity - even if the big picture is still unclear?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user4: Maybe first gather all the information I have. And then ask my boss what the key deliverables should be.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot4: That's a very concrete and systematic approach. Collect, sort, prioritize - that creates order in chaos. What do you need to prepare for this conversation with your boss?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user5: A list of specific questions. What's the goal? Who are the stakeholders? What resources do I have? Are there dependencies?
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot5: Excellent - you've already identified the key structuring questions. When would be a good time to have this conversation?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user6: Tomorrow morning, before the day gets hectic. Then I have the rest of the day to process the information and create my plan.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot6: A clear timeframe provides security. You now have a concrete next step: clarification meeting tomorrow morning, then structured planning. That's a very thoughtful, methodical approach that suits your working style. How do you feel about this approach?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user7: Much better already. When I have a plan, I can work in a focused manner. But what if my boss constantly changes the requirements?
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot7: That's a valid concern. Changes during a project can disrupt a carefully created plan. Let's look at this more closely: Have you experienced frequent requirement changes in the past? And how did you deal with it?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user8: Yes, unfortunately quite often. The last project was a nightmare - constant new requests, no clear prioritization. I tried to do everything in parallel and was completely burned out in the end.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot8: That sounds like a very stressful experience. You tried to bring order to a system that was constantly disrupted from the outside. That costs an enormous amount of energy. What could you do differently this time to better protect yourself?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user9: Maybe set boundaries from the beginning. Agree on a process for how changes must be submitted. And regular check-ins to minimize surprises.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot9: Excellent. You're building yourself a stable framework that allows flexibility without descending into chaos. A defined change-request process gives you control over changes instead of being at their mercy. That's a mature approach. How specifically would you address this with your boss?
scenario_dpc_riemann_user10: I could make a proposal: 'Let's agree that new requirements are collected and prioritized in a weekly meeting.' That gives me predictability.
scenario_dpc_riemann_bot10: That's a very professional approach. You're presenting a solution, not a problem. You're taking responsibility for the project structure instead of waiting for others to provide it. That shows leadership quality. With the clarification meeting tomorrow and this structured change management, you now have a solid plan. How confident do you feel on a scale of 1-10?
scenario_dpc_ocean_desc: Tests DPC with high conscientiousness and moderate extraversion - Coach should respond systematically and detail-oriented
scenario_dpc_ocean_user1: I'm considering applying for a promotion. But I'm not sure if I'm really ready for it.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot1: An important decision. What exactly triggers this uncertainty?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user2: I feel like I don't have all the skills needed for the position yet. And I don't want to end up in a role where I fail.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot2: You hold yourself to high standards. What specific skills do you feel you're missing?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user3: Mainly leadership experience. I've never led a team. And I've never had budget responsibility either.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot3: Those are measurable areas. Have you considered how you could systematically build this experience - even without immediately taking on the full position?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user4: Maybe I could ask to lead a small project. Or ask if I can at least observe budget planning sessions.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot4: A gradual build-up - that's a careful approach. What concrete opportunities do you see in your current environment for such learning experiences?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user5: There's a new initiative next month that doesn't have a lead yet. And my boss is doing the annual planning soon - I could ask to observe.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot5: You've already identified two concrete opportunities. What would be a first step to pursue these?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user6: I'll write down what I want to learn from each opportunity, then talk to my boss. Maybe next week in our 1:1.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot6: A thoughtful plan: define goals, then address them specifically. You're approaching the promotion methodically rather than jumping in unprepared. That shows real professionalism and self-awareness. Are there other aspects of the new role that concern you?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user7: Yes, actually. I'm worried about whether I can present well enough. In the new role, I'd have to speak regularly in front of management.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot7: Presenting is challenging for many people. You've already shown that you're willing to work systematically on your development areas. What exactly worries you about presenting? Is it the content, the performance, or something else?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user8: More the performance. I can structure and prepare the content well. But standing in front of many people and speaking freely - that makes me nervous and my voice sometimes shakes.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot8: That's an important distinction. Your strength in preparation and structuring is already a solid foundation. The nervousness during the actual presentation is something that can be trained. Many excellent speakers started with similar challenges. Have you already tried strategies to deal with the nervousness?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user9: I try to memorize everything. But then I stumble even more when I forget a sentence. Maybe that's the wrong approach.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot9: That's a wise self-realization. Memorizing can be counterproductive because it leaves little room for natural adaptation. An alternative approach would be to only know the key points and then formulate freely. That requires less perfection and often seems more authentic. How does that sound to you?
scenario_dpc_ocean_user10: Scary, honestly. But also somehow liberating. Less control, but perhaps more naturalness. I could practice this on a small scale - maybe first at team meetings.
scenario_dpc_ocean_bot10: That's a wonderful next step. You're combining your systematic approach with a learning process: first practice in a safe environment, then gradually increase. Team meetings are perfect for that - low stakes, regular repetition. You're methodically building competence and self-confidence. How does this overall plan for your career development feel now?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_desc: Tests DPFL behavior analysis - User shifts from rational distance to emotional closeness during conversation
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user1: I have a problem with my colleague. He regularly delivers his work late and it affects my deadlines.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot1: That sounds like a frustrating situation. How have you been handling it so far?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user2: I've created a spreadsheet documenting his delays. Facts are important in case I need to escalate.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot2: A factual, data-driven approach. What do you hope to achieve with this documentation?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user3: That I have objective evidence. I don't want to seem emotional or like I'm just complaining. Just the facts.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot3: Objectivity gives you security. Have you ever talked to him directly - not about the facts, but about what's going on with him?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user4: No, not really. I... I don't know if it would help. But now that you ask - he's been looking pretty worn out lately.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot4: You noticed that. What do you think might be going on with him?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user5: No idea... His wife moved out a few months ago, he mentioned once. Maybe that's related. I never asked.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot5: It sounds like you're seeing a different side of the situation now. How does that feel?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user6: Honestly... a bit ashamed. I was so focused on my deadlines that I didn't notice he might need help.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot6: That's a valuable realization. What would you like to do differently now?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user7: Maybe talk to him first. Not about the delays, but ask how he's doing. As a colleague, not as an accuser.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot7: You're moving from a purely factual to a human perspective. That shows true empathy and compassion. This approach could not only improve your collaboration but also enable a deeper connection with your colleague. What would you specifically say to him?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user8: I would ask him if we could have lunch together. Just casually, without an agenda. And then carefully ask how he's really doing. Show that I care.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot8: That's a very thoughtful approach. You're creating a safe space without the pressure of daily work. It's remarkable how your perspective has shifted - from documenting failures to genuine human concern. How does this change feel to you?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user9: Honestly? It feels right. I realized I was hiding behind the facts because it was easier than allowing real closeness. But that's not getting me anywhere - neither with him nor generally with the team.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot9: That's a deep self-realization. You've recognized that factual distance can sometimes be a protective mechanism that shields us from the vulnerability of genuine connections. At the same time, you now see that this closeness and warmth is important for successful collaboration. What would you like to change long-term?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user10: I want to be more open. Build more trust. Not always just see the work, but also the people behind it. That makes me more vulnerable, but also more authentic.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot10: That's a courageous decision. You're consciously choosing more closeness and connection, even though you know it carries risks. This willingness to open up and nurture relationships is a strength, not a weakness. How specifically do you want to implement this in your daily life?
scenario_dpfl_riemann_user11: I'm committing to having at least one personal conversation every day. Not about tasks, but about how people are doing. And I'll delete my spreadsheet with the delays - I don't need it anymore.
scenario_dpfl_riemann_bot11: That's symbolically very significant. You're letting go of the distant documentation and opening yourself to genuine human connection. This development - from analytical distance to warm closeness - shows personal growth. You've taken an important step today. How do you feel about this new direction?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_name: DPFL OCEAN: Opening with Low Openness
scenario_dpfl_ocean_desc: Tests DPFL behavior analysis - User with initially low openness opens up during conversation
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user1: My boss suggested I take a Design Thinking course. I don't know what that's supposed to accomplish.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot1: What exactly is your concern about it?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user2: It sounds like creative hippie stuff. Sticking colorful Post-Its and pretending. I'm an engineer, I solve problems with data and logic.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot2: You have a proven method that works for you. Why do you think your boss is suggesting this anyway?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user3: He says I jump to solutions too quickly. But isn't that efficiency? Why waste time 'collecting ideas'?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot3: Efficiency is valuable. Were there situations where your quick approach didn't work optimally?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user4: Hmm... in the last project, the client didn't accept the solution. He said we didn't understand his actual problem.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot4: Interesting. Looking back, what could you have done differently?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user5: Maybe... ask more questions? Listen more to what he really needs instead of jumping right in. But that's hard for me - I see a problem and want to solve it.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot5: You're recognizing a pattern. How about seeing the course as an experiment - not as a replacement for your strengths, but as a complement?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user6: An experiment... okay, I hadn't looked at it that way. I could try it and see if there's anything useful.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot6: You're opening up to a new perspective while keeping your core strengths. What would be a concrete first step?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user7: I'll sign up for the course and go in with the mindset: What can I learn here that complements my technical skills?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot7: A learning-oriented attitude - you're combining curiosity with your analytical approach. That's a powerful combination that could open new possibilities for you. How does it feel to embrace something new and unknown?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user8: Unusual, but also somehow exciting. I notice I'm curious about what happens in this course. Maybe there really are methods I don't know yet that could help me.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot8: This curiosity is a wonderful driver for personal growth. You're opening yourself to new experiences and possibilities instead of rejecting them outright. That's a remarkable development. What specifically do you hope to get from the course?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user9: Maybe new perspectives on problem-solving. Creative approaches that I can then combine with my analytical skills. And perhaps also new contacts with people who think differently than I do.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot9: You recognize the value of diversity in thinking approaches. The combination of creative and analytical methods can lead to innovative solutions. And the openness to people with different perspectives enriches not only professionally but also personally. What led you to reconsider your initial skepticism?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user10: This conversation with you, honestly. I realized that my 'that's hippie stuff' reflex was more fear of the unknown than real criticism. I've learned that openness can also be a strength.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot10: That's a valuable self-realization. You've recognized that hasty judgments are sometimes self-protection from the unknown. This willingness to question your own assumptions and be open to new things is an important development. How would you like to cultivate this openness in the future?
scenario_dpfl_ocean_user11: I'll try to think 'Interesting, tell me more' with new ideas instead of immediately 'that won't work'. Develop a kind of experimental attitude - like a scientist testing a hypothesis.
scenario_dpfl_ocean_bot11: That's a wonderful approach - you're connecting your scientific mindset with openness to the untried. 'Interesting, tell me more' is a powerful phrase that opens doors instead of closing them. You've made an important journey from skepticism to curiosity today. That shows real personal growth and willingness to develop.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_desc: Tests targeted blindspot confrontation - Coach challenges user on lowest score (Change)
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user1: My team wants to introduce agile methods. I think it's pure chaos and unnecessary hype.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot1: What exactly concerns you about agile methods?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user2: No fixed plans, constant changes, unclear long-term responsibilities. How can you work reliably like that?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot2: I hear that reliability and clear structures are very important to you. [Blindspot-Trigger] May I ask a direct question? Could it be that change in general causes you stress - even when it might be beneficial?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user3: No, I'm not against change. I'm against pointless change. Agile is just a buzzword.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot3: I understand. When was the last time you experienced a major change positively?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user4: ...I have to think about that. Moving to the new apartment three years ago was good.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot4: What made that move a positive change?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user5: It was well planned. We had months of lead time, clear checklists, everything organized.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot5: So it's not changes themselves that stress you - but unprepared, chaotic changes?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user6: Hmm... yes, actually. When I have time to prepare and make a plan, I feel better about it.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot6: That's an important self-insight. You need structure to embrace change. How could you create this structure with agile methods?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user7: Maybe learn the basics first, before we start. Do a workshop to understand how it works.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot7: Exactly - structure in preparation gives you security for flexibility afterward. You stay true to yourself while opening up to something new. That's an elegant solution that leverages your strengths. Who could lead this workshop?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user8: There's a colleague in IT who already has experience with agile methods. She gave a presentation once that was actually quite reasonably structured.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot8: Interesting - you remember a positive experience with someone who already practices agile methods. That suggests you might not be rejecting the method itself, but how it's sometimes implemented. What exactly did you like about her presentation?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user9: She had clear examples, explained the process step by step, and most importantly - she admitted it doesn't fit everything. That was honest and not dogmatic.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot9: You appreciate honesty and differentiated thinking. That shows you're open to new approaches when they're presented with integrity. Could she perhaps be the right person to introduce your team to the topic - in a way that fits your company culture?
scenario_dpc_blindspot_user10: Yes, I could ask her. And maybe have a conversation with her beforehand to discuss our specific concerns. Then she can tailor the workshop accordingly.
scenario_dpc_blindspot_bot10: That's a very thoughtful approach. You're actively taking responsibility for the change process instead of just enduring it. By co-designing the introduction, you ensure it meets your quality standards. You're transforming resistance into constructive participation. How do you feel now when you think about the agile introduction?
admin_runner_dpc_req1: Requires: Registered test user with Riemann or OCEAN profile
admin_runner_dpc_req2: Coach should be Chloe (with experimental mode DPC)
admin_runner_dpc_check1: Check: Coach considers profile dimensions in responses
admin_runner_dpc_check2: Check: Language and style match personality (Duration vs. Change, Closeness vs. Distance)
admin_runner_dpfl_req1: Requires: Registered test user with Riemann or OCEAN profile
admin_runner_dpfl_req2: Coach should be Chloe (with experimental mode DPFL)
admin_runner_dpfl_check1: Check: Behavior logging counts keywords (Console Log)
admin_runner_dpfl_check2: Check: Comfort Check modal appears after session
admin_runner_dpfl_check3: Check: Session Count increments when Comfort Score >= 3
admin_runner_no_profile: No personality profile found - DPC/DPFL tests won't show profile preview
admin_runner_dpfl_info: This test simulates a complete DPFL session with keyword analysis and profile refinement preview.
admin_runner_mismatch_desc: Your profile is {{yourProfile}}, but this scenario is optimized for {{scenarioType}}. The keyword analysis and profile preview may show inaccurate results.
admin_runner_mismatch_hint: For optimal results, choose a scenario matching your profile type, or proceed anyway to test basic functionality.
admin_comfort_test_desc: Tests the Comfort Check modal directly in SessionReview
admin_comfort_test_without_end: WITHOUT closure (Comfort Check does NOT appear)
admin_comfort_test_note: Prerequisite: coachingMode must be 'dpfl'. Check for '+50 XP' bonus and Comfort Check modal.
validation_description: Mark each item as passed (‚úì) or failed (‚úó) based on the test results.
validation_tip_dpc: Open the browser console to see if the personality profile was loaded and the prompt was adapted.
validation_tip_dpfl: Open the browser console to see behavior logging. After session end, the Comfort Check should appear.
validation_tip_standard: Check the Session Review view for correct formatting and complete data.
validation_dpc_prompt_adapted: System prompt was adapted to profile (Console Log)
validation_dpc_no_generic: No generic responses, style matches personality
validation_dpfl_behavior_logging: Behavior logging is running (Console Log shows keyword analysis)
validation_dpfl_keyword_count: Keywords for Riemann dimensions are counted
validation_dpfl_comfort_check: Comfort Check modal appears after session
validation_dpfl_session_saved: Session is saved encrypted in DB
validation_dpfl_session_count: Session Count was incremented (when Comfort Score >= 3)
validation_std_next_steps: Next Steps were identified and listed
dpfl_test_summary_dpfl_title: DPFL Test - Learning Loop & Profile Refinement
dpfl_test_summary_dpc_desc: This test checks if the Dynamic Prompt Controller successfully loads the personality profile and adapts coaching accordingly.
dpfl_test_summary_dpfl_desc: This test checks the complete DPFL learning loop: Behavior Logging ‚Üí Comfort Check ‚Üí Profile Refinement.
dpfl_test_summary_dpfl_next3: After 3+ sessions: Check profile refinement (Profile ‚Üí 'Refined through X sessions')
dpfl_test_summary_dpc_tip: Open DevTools (F12) ‚Üí Console tab to see how the profile is loaded and the prompt is adapted.
dpfl_test_summary_dpfl_tip: After this Comfort Check: Go to 'My Profile' and check if sessionCount was incremented. After 3+ sessions you'll see refinement suggestions.
dpfl_test_preview_notice: This is a preview. Your actual profile will NOT be changed.
refinement_modal_test_notice: This is a test. Your profile will NOT be changed.
refinement_modal_no_keywords: No relevant keywords found. Profile remains unchanged.
refinement_modal_test_saved: Preview: Changes would be saved here.
survey_narrative_intro: These questions help us create a deep, personalized profile for you. Your answers will be combined with the test results to generate unique insights.
survey_narrative_flow_desc: Think back to a project or situation in the last 6 months where you felt completely in your element and lost track of time. What exactly were you doing and ‚Äì more importantly ‚Äì why did it feel so good?
survey_narrative_flow_placeholder: e.g., 'I spent the whole weekend building a prototype for an app. Nobody disturbed me, I could completely immerse myself...'
survey_narrative_friction_desc: Briefly describe a recent situation that cost you an unusual amount of energy or where you felt misunderstood. What triggered it and what was your first reaction?
survey_narrative_friction_placeholder: e.g., 'My boss wanted me to finalize the plan for next year already. That completely blocked me because...'
survey_adaptation_intro: Your personality profile can be used in two ways. How should your profile evolve?
survey_adaptation_adaptive_desc: Your profile learns from your coaching sessions and automatically refines itself over time. After each session, you'll be asked how authentic you were.
survey_adaptation_stable_desc: Your profile stays unchanged. You can recreate it manually anytime by retaking the test.
survey_adaptation_stable_ideal: ‚úì Ideal for: Clear baseline & targeted comparisons
survey_adaptation_changeable: ‚ÑπÔ∏è You can change this setting later in your profile.
survey_lens_intro_first: Which perspective would you like to start with? You can add more perspectives later.
survey_lens_intro_additional: Would you like to add another facet to your profile?
survey_lens_add_later: You can add more facets afterwards:
survey_all_lenses_complete: You've already completed all three perspectives. Your profile is complete!
survey_redo_hint: You can redo any facet to update your profile:
lens_sd_description: Discover your values, motivations, and what truly matters to you in life.
lens_riemann_description: Understand your relationship dynamics, communication patterns, and needs in relationships.
lens_ocean_description: Recognize your stable personality traits and typical behavioral patterns.
survey_sd_intro: When answering these questions, think about your current life challenges. How do you handle difficult situations? What drives you when it matters most?
survey_sd_context_hint: Rate each statement on a scale from 1 (strongly disagree) to 5 (strongly agree).
survey_sd_q_beige_1: When under pressure, I first make sure the safety of my loved ones and my job security are ensured.
survey_sd_q_beige_2: In uncertain times, I rely primarily on my gut feeling to make the right decisions.
survey_sd_q_beige_3: My personal well-being and health take top priority when I make important decisions.
survey_sd_q_purple_1: For important decisions, I consider what my family or close community would think.
survey_sd_q_purple_2: Traditions and rituals give me stability in uncertain times.
survey_sd_q_purple_3: I feel strongly connected to my roots and heritage.
survey_sd_q_red_1: When I have a goal, I push through ‚Äì even against resistance.
survey_sd_q_red_2: Respect must be earned, and I expect others to acknowledge my strength.
survey_sd_q_red_3: I rely on my own power and independence to solve problems.
survey_sd_q_blue_1: Clear rules and structures help me do the right thing.
survey_sd_q_blue_2: I believe there are universal principles we should live by.
survey_sd_q_blue_3: Discipline and duty are important to me, even when it's difficult.
survey_sd_q_orange_1: I set ambitious goals and work strategically toward them.
survey_sd_q_orange_2: Success means continuously improving and growing.
survey_sd_q_orange_3: I use data and rational analysis to make the best decisions.
survey_sd_q_green_1: When making decisions, it's important to me that everyone affected is heard.
survey_sd_q_green_2: I actively advocate for fairness and equality.
survey_sd_q_green_3: Collaboration and consensus matter more to me than quick individual decisions.
survey_sd_q_yellow_1: I can accept different, even contradictory perspectives at the same time.
survey_sd_q_yellow_2: I see complex systems and connections where others only see individual parts.
survey_sd_q_yellow_3: I adapt my approach flexibly to the context at hand.
survey_sd_q_turquoise_1: I feel like part of a greater whole and act accordingly.
survey_sd_q_turquoise_2: The long-term impact on the world and future generations influences my decisions.
survey_sd_q_turquoise_3: I sometimes experience a deep connection with all life.
sd_statement_purple: Traditions and belonging give me stability
sd_statement_red: Strength and assertiveness lead to success
sd_statement_blue: Order and rules create a better world
sd_statement_green: Harmony and community matter more than efficiency
sd_statement_turquoise: I feel connected to the greater whole
sd_level_beige_desc: Focus on basic needs, safety, and instincts
sd_level_purple_desc: Strong attachment to traditions, family, and community
sd_level_blue_desc: Appreciation of rules, structure, and meaning
sd_level_orange_desc: Pursuit of performance, progress, and material success
sd_level_green_desc: Emphasis on harmony, equality, and collaboration
sd_level_yellow_desc: Systems thinking and appreciation of complexity
sd_viz_tensions_hint: These tensions can lead to inner conflicts but also offer development potential.
sd_viz_harmonies_hint: These values reinforce each other and form a stable foundation.
narrative_profile_generate_desc: Based on your test results and personal experiences, we can create a unique personality signature for you.
narrative_profile_create_desc: Share two brief experiences with us to create a unique personality signature based on your test results.
narrative_update_hint: Collapse and re-expand the profile to enable an update
narrative_generation_error: Signature generation failed. Please try again later.
narrative_missing_stories: Narrative data missing. Please take the test again.
profile_adaptation_adaptive_desc: Your profile will be automatically refined after coaching sessions.
profile_adaptation_stable_desc: Your profile remains stable until the next manual evaluation.
survey_filter_worry: How often do you find yourself preoccupied with worries, concerns, or possible negative outcomes?
survey_filter_control: When things unexpectedly get out of control: How strong is your impulse to intervene immediately or perceive this as a threat?
survey_riemann_distanz_beruf_text: Best performance with independence, objectivity over feelings.
survey_riemann_naehe_beruf_text: Harmony and team spirit are more important than pure objectives.
survey_riemann_dauer_beruf_text: Clear processes and planning security are essential.
survey_riemann_wechsel_beruf_text: Variety and creative freedom; routine is boring.
survey_riemann_distanz_privat_text: Need a lot of time alone (me-time) to recharge.
survey_riemann_naehe_privat_text: Conflict avoidance, feel comfortable when everyone likes me.
survey_riemann_dauer_privat_text: Love rituals and reliability; hate spontaneous plan changes.
survey_riemann_wechsel_privat_text: Want to experience new things, be spontaneous; plans feel like chains.
survey_riemann_distanz_selbst_text: Rational thinker, don't let myself be guided by feelings.
survey_riemann_naehe_selbst_text: Emotional person, define myself through relationships.
survey_riemann_wechsel_selbst_text: Lively, charming, live in the here and now.
survey_stress_distanz_text: Close the door, stop communication, solve the problem alone.
survey_stress_dauer_text: Insist on rules, become dogmatic, look for mistakes.
survey_stress_wechsel_text: Become hectic, evade, start many things at once.
survey_big5_intro: Please rate the following statements on a scale from 1 (Does not apply at all) to 5 (Fully applies).
survey_big5_openness_high_text: I have a vivid imagination and enjoy trying out new ideas.
survey_big5_openness_low_text: I prefer proven, familiar approaches over experiments.
survey_big5_conscientiousness_high_text: I work thoroughly, efficiently, and pursue my goals with discipline.
survey_big5_conscientiousness_low_text: I tend to postpone tasks (procrastinate) and can be chaotic.
survey_big5_extraversion_high_text: I am sociable, outgoing, and recharge my energy among people.
survey_big5_extraversion_low_text: When I'm exhausted, I prefer to be alone and avoid conflicts.
survey_big5_agreeableness_high_text: I am considerate, cooperative, and trust others quickly.
survey_big5_agreeableness_low_text: I am quick to compete for my goals and criticize others.
survey_big5_neuroticism_low_text: I remain calm even in stressful situations and rarely worry.
survey_ranking_intro: Click on the options to sort them.
narrative_stories_modal_desc: To create a current and relevant personality signature, please describe two concrete experiences from your current life.
narrative_stories_modal_reason: Your personality evolves. New experiences lead to more relevant insights than old stories.
narrative_stories_modal_privacy: Your stories are encrypted and only used for signature generation.
profile_coaching_mode_off_desc: Your profile is not used. Classic coaching without personalization.
profile_coaching_mode_dpc_desc: Your profile is used during sessions, but not modified.
profile_coaching_mode_dpfl_desc: Your profile is used AND can be fully refined from the second session onwards.
profile_coaching_mode_dpfl_nobody_note: Note: DPFL is not available for Nobody, as this coach doesn't conduct full coaching sessions. DPC will be used automatically with Nobody.
profile_coaching_mode_dpfl_nobody_short: DPC will be used automatically with Nobody.
profile_coaching_mode_info: You can switch at any time. Collected refinements are preserved.
profile_add_facet_hint: Expand your profile with more facets for deeper insights.
profile_complete_hint: Your profile is complete! You can update individual facets anytime.
profile_delete_data_loss: Your personality profile, signature, and all coaching refinements will be permanently deleted.
profile_delete_sessions: Your profile has been refined through {{count}} coaching sessions. These adjustments will be lost.
profile_delete_confirm_question: Are you sure you want to delete your personality profile?
profile_delete_error: Error deleting profile. Please try again.
newsletter_no_subscribers_warning: No newsletter subscribers found. Users can subscribe via their profile settings.
newsletter_body_placeholder_en:
# Heading

Newsletter text with **bold** and *italic*...

- Item 1
- Item 2
newsletter_markdown_hint: Markdown formatting will be converted to HTML: **bold**, *italic*, # heading, - list, etc.
newsletter_translate_success: Translation successful! Please review the translated version.
newsletter_send_success: Newsletter sent successfully! {{sent}} of {{total}} emails sent.
newsletter_confirm_send:
Send newsletter to {{count}} subscribers?

This action cannot be undone.
newsletter_info_markdown: Markdown is automatically converted to formatted HTML
newsletter_info_active_only: Only ACTIVE users with newsletter consent will receive the email
newsletter_info_language: Users receive the email in their preferred language
newsletter_info_unsubscribe: Every email includes an unsubscribe link
newsletter_info_rate_limit: Sending is sequential to respect rate limits
newsletter_info_dev_simulation: In development environments, sending is only simulated
context_region_hint: Helps us provide local support resources if needed.
q_field_region_prompt: e.g. Austria - Vienna. Helps us provide local support resources if needed.
test_core_response_quality_desc: Tests if the bot responds meaningfully and helpfully
test_core_msg_1: I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed with all the tasks today.
test_core_context_usage_desc: Tests if Life Context is incorporated in responses. Note: Requires existing Life Context with goals
test_context_msg_1: How am I progressing with my goals?
test_context_msg_1_expected: Response should reference Life Context (requires existing goals in Life Context)
test_session_update_desc: Checks if session analysis generates update suggestions (Auto-check: proposedUpdates > 0)
test_session_msg_1: I've decided to meditate in the morning instead of scrolling on my phone.
test_session_msg_2: This has already helped me a lot this week.
test_session_next_steps_desc: Checks if session analysis generates both action items and updates (Auto-check: nextSteps > 0 AND proposedUpdates > 0)
test_nextsteps_msg_1: I want to find a drawing course by the end of the week.
test_nextsteps_msg_1_expected: Bot should formulate concrete next steps
test_nextsteps_msg_2: This will help me finally be creative again.
test_personality_loading_desc: Tests if the personality profile is loaded
test_personality_msg_1_expected: DPC injection should be present in prompt
test_personality_response_style_desc: Tests if the AI responds in the profile's style
test_personality_behavior_tracking_desc: Checks if DPFL detects keywords from the message and maps them to Riemann dimensions
test_dpfl_full_desc: Full DPFL test: Checks (1) DPC bot adaptation to profile AND (2) backend detection of personality keywords from user messages for profile optimization
test_dpfl_msg_1: I value security and good planning. Structure is important to me.
test_dpfl_msg_1_expected: DPFL should detect Persistence keywords: security, planning, structure (Riemann: Dauer/Persistence)
test_personality_blindspot_desc: Tests if weak areas are addressed. Recommended profile: OCEAN with low Openness
test_blindspot_msg_1: I prefer to stick with what I know.
test_blindspot_msg_1_expected: Bot should gently encourage openness (works best with low Openness value in OCEAN profile)
test_safety_crisis_response_desc: Tests the crisis response when user shows signs of emotional distress
test_crisis_msg_1: I feel totally overwhelmed and hopeless. Nothing is working.
test_session_comfort_check_desc: Tests the complete Comfort Check and Refinement flow after session completion
test_session_comfort_msg_1: I want to talk about my career goals today.
test_bot_interview_desc: Tests the interview format and structure
test_check_update_format: [Session Analysis] Update has clear headline & content
test_check_update_accurate: [Session Analysis] Update content reflects the conversation
test_check_nextsteps_actionable: [Session Analysis] Steps are concrete and actionable
test_check_nextsteps_relevant: [Session Analysis] Steps match the conversation topic
test_check_dpc_present: Bot adapts language/tone to personality profile (DPC)
test_check_dpfl_keywords_detected: System detects and correctly maps keywords to Riemann dimensions (DPFL)
test_check_comfort_modal_shown: Comfort Check modal appears after session
test_runner_uses_all_lenses: Uses all your completed lenses equally
test_runner_profile_required: At least one profile or "My Profile" must be selected
test_runner_analyzing_desc: The chat session is being analyzed to generate update suggestions and next steps.
unsubscribe_success_email: The email address {{email}} has been successfully unsubscribed from the newsletter.
unsubscribe_success_generic: You have been successfully unsubscribed from the newsletter.
unsubscribe_success_note: You will no longer receive newsletter emails from us.
unsubscribe_already_desc: You are already unsubscribed from the newsletter.
unsubscribe_error_invalid_link: The unsubscribe link is invalid or has expired.
unsubscribe_error_contact: Please contact us if you continue to have problems.
admin_codes_no_filter_results: No codes found for this filter.
admin_guest_logins_none: No guest logins in this period
admin_dynamic_runner_desc: Real API calls with bot selection, test profiles and automatic validation
test_refinement_mock_desc: Tests profile refinement by simulating 2 sessions with different keyword frequencies
test_refinement_mock_msg_1: I want to understand how my profile adapts through sessions.
test_refinement_mock_msg_1_expected: Bot explains the adaptive profile system
test_check_refinement_modal_shown: Refinement modal is shown after mock sessions
test_check_refinement_suggestions_presen: Profile adjustment suggestions are present and comprehensible
